sentences.en: He was too out of condition to clamber over the top.
sentences.cn: 他体质太差，爬不到山顶。

sentences.en: It was difficult to clamber the mountain.
sentences.cn: 爬上那座大山是困难的.

sentences.en: It was easy enough for him to clamber up the gnarled trunk.
sentences.cn: 他攀上这扭曲的树干,倒还容易.

sentences.en: Reaching the crest was a real clamber.
sentences.cn: 到达顶峰才是真正的攀登.

sentences.en: Sailor as he was, it was easy enough for him to clamber up the gnarled trunk.
sentences.cn: 他虽说是个水手,攀上这扭曲的树干, 倒还容易.

sentences.en: Teenage boys clamber down mine shafts 30 to 50 meters deep.
sentences.cn: 孩子们沿着杆子爬到深30到50米的矿井里.

sentences.en: To clamber up the pecking order, some people slave away nights and weekends at the office.
sentences.cn: 为了攀爬上更高的等级, 一些人晚上和周末也在办公室苦干.

sentences.en: We all clambered aboard and the boat pulled out.
sentences.cn: 我们全都爬上船后，船就开了。

sentences.en: We had a good time of that clamber.
sentences.cn: 那次攀登让我们很愉快.

trans.tran_en: to climb or move slowly somewhere, using your hands and feet because it is difficult or steep
